title: Syntax error in lib/spack/spack/build_systems/intel.py
body:
I believe that in 

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/2656ed63eb488b6450829fb1abd8fd4a08ad0f35/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/intel.py#L763

`threading_engine_libs = self.openmp_libs()`

should be

`threading_engine_libs = self.openmp_libs`

as at https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/2656ed63eb488b6450829fb1abd8fd4a08ad0f35/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/intel.py#L674 it is defined as a property.


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
spack install cblas ^intel-mkl threads=openmp
```

### Error Message
```console
wscullin@flubber:/sp/spack> spack install cblas ^intel-mkl threads=openmp
==> intel-mkl@2018.2.199 : externally installed in /opt/intel/compilers_and_libraries_2018.2.199/linux/mkl
==> intel-mkl@2018.2.199 : already registered in DB
==> Installing cblas
==> Fetching file:///sp/projects/datascience/soft/builds/spack/mirror/cblas/cblas-2015-06-06.tgz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /sp/projects/datascience/soft/builds/spack/mirror/cblas/cblas-2015-06-06.tgz
==> Fetching from file:///sp/projects/datascience/soft/builds/spack/mirror/cblas/cblas-2015-06-06.tgz failed.
==> Fetching http://www.netlib.org/blas/blast-forum/cblas.tgz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /sp/spack/var/spack/stage/cblas-2015-06-06-puaogaktnjzkrdcq6uxl3q5d7cvmwyxx/cblas.tgz
==> Created stage in /sp/spack/var/spack/stage/cblas-2015-06-06-puaogaktnjzkrdcq6uxl3q5d7cvmwyxx
==> Error: TypeError: 'LibraryList' object is not callable

/sp/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/intel.py:762, in blas_libs:
        759            if '%intel' in self.spec:
        760                mkl_threading = 'libmkl_intel_thread'
        761            elif '%gcc' in self.spec:
  >>    762                mkl_threading = 'libmkl_gnu_thread'
        763            threading_engine_libs = self.openmp_libs()
        764        elif self.spec.satisfies('threads=tbb'):
        765            mkl_threading = 'libmkl_tbb_thread'
```


### Information on your system


I can do this under develop on several systems. Pull request forthcoming.
